docs.title: PRAO of Roza
docs.text:
• When: Wednesday November 26th 2025 9:00-16:00 (see schedule)
  • Where in Uppsala: Biomedical Center, Husargatan: see location how to get there
  • Where in BMC: office B9:430b: see office how to get there
  • Schedule: see schedule
  • Report: see report
  • Reflection: see reflection
  • Reflection from supervisor: see Reflection from supervisor
  • Tips from previous interns

docs.title: Goal
docs.text: To find out how working life at NBIS/UPPMAX/UU is like.

docs.title: Project
docs.text: To be discussed in the first hour.

docs.title: Contact me
docs.text: Contact me at the email address shown at my GitHub account.

docs.title: What should I bring?
docs.text:
• a laptop
  • (optional) food

docs.title: Where in Uppsala is this?
docs.text: At the Biomedical Center, Husargatan. See location how to get there.

docs.title: Where in the Biomedical Center must I be?
docs.text: At office B9:430b. See office how to get there

docs.title: Are there microwaves to heat my lunch food?
docs.text: Yes.

docs.title: Location
docs.text:
We meet at the Biomedical Center in Uppsala at the Husargatan:

At BMC, we will meet at my office. See my office how to get there.

docs.title: Office
docs.text:
The office has room number B9:430b and can be found at at Mazemap here.

To reach my office, enter at entrance C11 (it has SciLifeLab above it). In the hallways, take the stairs down.

Enter at entrance C11. In the hallways, take the stairs down

Note from Roza: you could also go to the second floor and go there.

In the basement, turn right and follow the long corridor until the first square. There, take the person elevator or take the stairs, to floor 4.

turn right and follow the loooong corridor until the first square Take the person elevator or stairs to floor 4.

At the fourth floor, go past the toilets. It's the first door at the left.

Go past the toilets. It's the first door at the left. If you are at the ping-pong table, you've gone too far.

docs.title: Reflection
docs.text:
The goal of a reflection is to improve.

One does so writing down how a passed day went: what did yo do, how did it go and how can it be improved?

By forcing oneself to think of this, one can actually learn from the past.

docs.title: What did you do?
docs.text: i did a litterature study

docs.title: What did you do well?
docs.text: well i was very focused and didnt have any distractions

docs.title: What could be improved?
docs.text: i could be more on time and maybe remember what to bring what i need

docs.title: What did your supervisor do well?
docs.text: he asnwered my questions well and helped a lot.

docs.title: How can your supervisor be improved?
docs.text: i dont think there is anything to improve

docs.title: What would you do differently next time?
docs.text: be on time, have my materials.

docs.title: Which tip would you give to future PRAO students?
docs.text: Dont be shy to ask qusteions and dont have any distractions

docs.title: What I did well
docs.text: I treated Roza like a real colleague.

docs.title: What I could do better
docs.text: I had too much fun talking to such a gifted mind: maybe I should have treated her worse.

docs.title: My conclusion about my PRAO
docs.text:
• Roza was 32 minutes late. I hope she learns to be on time next time
  • Roza has a good work ethics: she did not mind to work longer to make up for being late
  • Roza had forgotten her laptop. I hope she learns to be prepared next time
  • Roza dares to ask for help: when she first arrived at my office, there was a man with here that showed her the way to my office
  • Roza is great at saying what she thinks
  • Roza dares to disagree, does so politely and can give proper reasons why her viewpoint differs

My recommendation to a future employer would be to absolutely try to get her: she is one of the most allround gifted minds at her age that I ever met.

If Rosa ever needs help, I will happily help out as much as I can. Thanks for the fun day!

  • Roza is flexible: when I sent Roza home to fetch her laptop, she took it well

docs.title: Report
docs.text:
:Project: Teaching: literature review: should online teaching be recorded live?

  • [1]: I do think this is useful, because its says what could go wrong and while its also useful like the papers pros and cons , for example here they point out why it should not be recorded "s. One unintended result of recorded lectures is that students may stop coming to campus, which could weaken the success, usefulness, and impact of student professional groups and organizations. Relying completely on online classes might also limit students’ ability to interact with people in real life situations without using technology.”" and here why they think its good ", in some cases, can be reused in other or future classes, which helps save teachers’ time.” They do give reason to why it could be good but it more on the side which does not think its should be recorded

  • [2]: i also think this is useful because it shows precentage of the students opinion and it also showed the aftermath as if somebody viewed the recording after, they said " 6 months after the recording no student rewatched the recording for over a minute" and it told us that recording is no big of a use in classes even though 100% of the student described it as "useful" and in this article they tell us straight up they do not support the routine of recording classes

  • i couldnt really find a litterature about recordings in online classes and that tells us that they havent done a reasearch on that yet but they have reasearched about recordings in a physical class where the student are there in real time.All of the articles i read about is leaning more towards disagareements about recordings in a class with the students are there in real time and does not support the routine whilst there is good arguments about having recordings in a online class but there is also bad arguements but more on the idea that is a good thing but sadly there is no reasearch done on that
Reference Findings [1] For Roza [2] 100% (31 out of 31 students) liked recordings [2] 0% (0 out of 31 students) actually watched the recordings for over a minute Reference Recommendation [1] Against live recording [2] Against live recording

docs.title: References
docs.text:
• [1] Romanelli, Frank, Jeff Cain, and Kelly M. Smith. "To record or not to record?." American journal of pharmaceutical education 75.8 (2011).

  • [2]Crook, Peter, et al. "Small-group teaching: should it be recorded?." Medical Science Educator 33.5 (2023): 1073-1079.

docs.title: Schedule
docs.text: Start What 9:00 Be at Richel's office B9:430b . Get coffee/tea/chocolate milk . Discuss goal of PRAO . Discuss project of PRAO . Discuss method of achieving goal: report and reflection . Log in PRAO student (if needed) . Discuss practical things (a.o. access card, toilet) 10:00 Break 10:15 Work on project 11:00 Break 11:15 Work on project 12:00 Break 12:15 Work on project 13:00 Break 13:15 Work on project 14:00 Break 14:15 Work on project 15:00 Break 15:15 Work on project, finalize report 15:30 write down reflection and reflection from supervisor 15:45 Discuss reflection 16:00 Done

docs.title: Tips from former students
docs.text:
Stay calm and focused and you will get it done, even if it feels stressful you'll get it done in the end. Remember the goal of a PRAO. The start is the hardest, it gets easier.

Emil

Make sure to get a good idea of what to do before starting so that you don't lose time due to misunderstanding the assignment.

Frans

Listen carefully to the explanations when you're given them. If you lose focus important information could be lost on you, and if you simply listen and take your time processing the info, a lot of issues can be avoided.

Noah

Take time to think through and plan the assignments beforehand so you have more time to spend writing and doing the assignment.

Johannes

Do your best! Don't give up, it might be hard at first but it gets better. Just belive in yourself and you will make it!

Signe

Ask the supervisor for extensive instructions

Olle

PLEASE aks questions when you don't understand. Don't ask the stupid AI, instead ask the smart human who is next to you at almost all the time: he knows better than AI trust me ;)

Max (with some spelling adaptions)
